abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Ecuador Institutional
            Reform Project were as follows: the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            unsatisfactory, all other ratings are not applicable since
            the operation is cancelled. The Loan was approved by the
            Board on June 22, 2004, but was not signed or made effective
            within 18 months of Board approval. The Government of
            Ecuador failed to meet the prerequisites for project
            effectiveness, and the deadline for compliance was exceeded
            in December 2005. The Government also did not submit the
            required documents to support fulfillment of loan
            conditionality's. Despite Bank efforts to assist the
            Government of Ecuador with documentation requirements and
            facilitate project effectiveness, the authorities appeared
            to no longer be committed to project implementation. Some
            lessons learned are: political instability complicates
            project implementation; political instability affects
            government leadership and commitment to reforms; and
            individual projects' successful implementation is
            critically dependent on the broader context of relations
            with the World Bank.
